intro: Wyethia elata, commonly known as the tall goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and upright growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched. Wyethia elata is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential medicinal properties.
